"The Gates of Europe," by Serhii Plokhy
"White Guard," by Bulgakov

What else?
"What do you mean I can't expense body armor?"
@kaushikpatnaik Everything. It's all amazing.
@bentboolean Nice. Unboxed, I think it just about fits in a carry-on. The box is a bit inefficient space-wise.

Indian gf has resorted to *hiding* the Indian snacks her mother sends somewhere in the house since I can't be trusted to not finish them in short order. 

That's where we are in this relationship. 

She rations them out slowly, and I can't find the stash.
Also, are they yelling at each other across the table, or is there an intercom system?

At this distance, might consider doing a Zoom. 

Also, the fact Putin allows these pics to get out, and doesn't realize it makes him look crazy, is part of what makes him crazy. https://t.co/3yGg9eKbN5

@JakeGrosek We won't know the damage we've wreaked for years yet.
The Stanford cap is like the cherry on top.

My kid doesn't like taking her mask *off* now, since she considers walking around with it on normal. 

It's so, so odd. 

But then, the COVID period is close to 100% of her memory...
The Internet doth provide. https://t.co/CFVjyeW0Sb
Mask mandate over in SF last week, and people still wearing them like it's a religious item, a sort of facial kippah.
God damn. https://t.co/p5jPJw9mw8

Jewish follower commenting on the world's most heroic Jew right now, Zelensky: The question is if he's Judah Maccabee or if it's Masada again.

The fact Jewish history has a tragic parallel for everything is....something. There's *always* a Jewish version of the problem.
@syiblet I think once you get on the Christian train, and assuming you have industrialization and literacy, something like the secular liberalism we see now is basically inevitable, yes.

@bryanrbeal Leaving me out of it, I do think tech is this unlikely fountain of culture right now. It's perhaps one of the few dynamic sectors of American society left, and it's touching everything (for better or worse).
@bryanrbeal Hey, thanks!

For believers in teleological theories of history, i.e., that secular liberalism is the inevitable end state of Judeo-Christian thought, this is another data point that we're all converging on Denmark. 

If and only if we're not forced back into History by those with other plans.

While the commentariat inside the decadent West debates liberalism's end-state lunacies--Putin as a proxy for the CRT battle--to the Ukrainians, the EU (I imagine) represents liberalism's original promise: freedom from autocracy, national liberation, the end of ethnic violence.

One of the great historical ironies with the Ukraine situation is that you have a country valiantly and violently struggling--president in military garb, sandbagged doors in a besieged capital--to join the post-Historical oasis of the Nietzschean Last Man, the EU. https://t.co/16ZVfA5u6w
RT @neontaster: https://t.co/Uy4Qxoy9Fu

This is how many an offroad adventure ends up. 

As a note re: mud in the winter, wait for nightfall and the mud to freeze. Then dig out the treads/tires, and drive it out. 

(This works with jeeps. Not sure about T-90s).

Bro, I'm stuck in the mud. 
I'll get my tow cable and get you out.
